title: Gmail
text:
Something is a miss Gmail app. If I‚Äôm in a composing situation, it barely holds in place while I click the people I want to send it to and then I write on the subject line. Before I know it back to the menu and where are my attachments they‚Äôre nowhere. There must be a little bug somewhere and it‚Äôs not fun. Thank you that‚Äôs why I gave it three stars.
Additionally, I cannot enlarge the schedule of mail delivered to me by pinching the screen. Not good for someone who has bad eyes.
Would you send me a survey on how terrible to add a photo to a email or text and it wants to give you full access to my videos and photos. Sometimes people have pictures of their toes that might be infected and they‚Äôve kept a daily diary for the doctor. I don‚Äôt think you need to see that. And since I have so many pictures, it would probably take me a week to sit there and go through them and sort my pictures for public use or no public use. Why do you restrict me using my own photos in my own Gmail, text message? What‚Äôs the reason. There is something called privacy that you do not need to see all my photos. If I post it on Facebook or Google Mail or messenger or messages, that is public. Quit asking me for permission to have my phone opened up for you for photos and videos. What do you need my photos and videos for,? Are you writing a book?

title: the best thing about gmail
text: Google Gmail is more than just an email service‚Äîit‚Äôs a powerful tool that offers a plethora of features. Whether you‚Äôre using it for personal or business purposes, you‚Äôll find a treasure trove of features. From seamless collaboration tools to efficient spam filtering, Gmail has you covered. It seamlessly integrates with other Google services like Google Drive and Google Calendar, making everything interconnected in one ecosystem‚Äîa big bonus for productivity. Smart Compose suggests text as you type, making email composition quicker, and there‚Äôs a personalized setting that tailors suggestions to your writing style. Gmail also nudges you with handy reminders, highlighting emails you sent a few days ago to ensure important messages don‚Äôt slip through the cracks. While the free version is robust for personal use, businesses may prefer Google Workspace plans starting at $6 per user per month. These plans come with custom business email addresses, cloud storage, and video meeting capabilities. The advanced Business Plus plan offers 5TB of cloud storage and can host video meetings for up to 250 people. In summary, Gmail is undoubtedly one of the best email services on the market, offering value that‚Äôs well worth it, especially when considering the broader Google Workspace features. Whether you‚Äôre a business professional or a casual user, Gmail streamlines communication and boosts productivity.

title: Google lack of support
text: Ran out of storage as I sometimes do. I was up to about a 102% of my 15 GB storage. I moved some photographs off of my account to bring me down to 98%. Around three days later I was still unable to receive or send emails though I could access my email that already existed up until the point of google freezing my account. I understood that it might take a day for my email to start working properly. It did not work properly on the second day. It did not work properly on the third day. On the fourth day, I was directed to the iTunes Store to purchase additional storage. I said OK Google wins I‚Äôll purchase 100 GB of storage. I was delighted to find that I was all the way down to 14% usage on my new found additional storage. I went straight to my Gmail and no luck. The same emails I have been looking at for days were at the top. 24 hours later same emails. I did a search and found out that sometimes apple pays 24 hours later then it will take an additional 24 hours for Google to update my status. Well here I am three days after payment and an official upgrade to my storage and still no access to new emails or the ability to send. I called Apple and asked Apple why they would sell a product that doesn‚Äôt work. I escalated until I could not escalate anymore. They put in a service request so I will see where this goes,, or maybe not. Not happy with Apple. Not happy with Google. I will begin the process of manually migrating all of my photos. I will be looking for alternatives. Beware of Google customer support. Beware of apples allegiance to other corporate overlords. Cheers, and good luck.
